title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 472.3 - Maximum gross weight of tractors
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 472.3 - Maximum gross weight of tractors

State Regulations

Tax Law, ยง 501, subd. 4
(a) The maximum gross weight of a tractor for
permit purposes is the unloaded weight of the tractor plus the maximum load, to
be carried or hauled by it on New York public highways. As indicated above, the
maximum gross weight cannot be less than the unloaded weight of the tractor
plus the weight of the trailer and the maximum load to be carried by the
trailer. The maximum gross weight of a tractor shall not include the weight of
a driver and his helper. (b) The
maximum gross weight of a tractor-trailer combination for weighing and tax rate
purposes is the unloaded weight of the tractor plus the maximum gross weight of
the trailer. Example: If a tractor has an unloaded weight of 12,200 pounds and
the heaviest trailer to be hauled by it in New York has a maximum gross weight
of 49,800 pounds, the maximum gross weight of the tractor for permit purposes
is 62,000 pounds. Notes
